answerText: photoelectric effect[10] According to the photoelectric effect, the incident photon must have energy greater than this quantity in order to cause the metal to release electrons.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Louisville Round 11 | 17 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This effect was first explained in one of Einstein's 1905 Annus Mirabilis papers, which would later win him a Nobel Prize. For 10 points each: [10] Name this phenomenon in which metals exposed to high-energy photons emit electrons.
